intro: Phyllanthera sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran phyllanthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
